文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_036_chunk1
证据片段: The proposed mechanism contributes to the corrosion rate acceleration only when hydride precipitation is favored at the metal-oxide interface (i.e., under low oxygen coolant conditions).

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_036_chunk1
证据片段: Under high dissolved oxygen conditions of the coolant, the liberated hydrogen will prefer to combine with the excess oxygen rather than going to the metal.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_036_chunk1
证据片段: With oxidizing coolant conditions, the hydride precipitation in the metal is discouraged; therefore the corrosion rate acceleration associated with the hydride precipitation and fracture is not expected to be observed.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_036_chunk2
证据片段: Up to 100 times the rate seen in pure water was obtained in supercritical water with high LiOH levels

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_036_chunk2
证据片段: The best correlation to the in-reactor behavior was obtained for a Li content in the range of 75 to $1 9 0 \ \mathsf { p p m }$ in the temperature range of 390 to $4 1 0 \mathrm { { ‰} }$

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_036_chunk2
证据片段: The corrosion rate for Zircaloy-4 in steam containing LiOH has been observed to be higher than in water with LiOH for tests below the critical temperature
